original: Bohm, Verner Assar Ludvig, överläkare, Linköping, f. 28/7/84 i Lund av dir. Herman B. o. Augusta Norling. G. 12 m. Inga Leffler. Barn: Åke f. 13, Gunnar o. Maj 15, Einar 17, Lennart 19, Brita 25. — Mog:ex. i Linköp. 02, med. fil. ex. i Lund 03, med. kand. där 06, med. lic. i Sthlm 11. Aman. i med. kemi i Lund 05-06, aman. v. Seraf :las. röntgeninst. 09-10, tf. förest, där samt v. Radiumihemm. 11, .aman, v. Seraf :las. kir. poliklin. 12-13, v. dess kir. klin. 14, und:kir. v. Seraf :las. 15, aman. v. dess ögonklin. samt tf. läk, v. Kristianstads, Eskilstuna o. Söderköp. las. 16, förste und :läk. v. Linköp. las. 16-23, las:läk. i Mora 23-28, i Hudiksvall 2S-37, överläk. v. kir. avd. å länslas. i Linköp. sed. 37, styresm. där 38-46. V. ordf. i styr. f. Birgitta sjuksköt ::skoila ’sed. 39. KV02kil, RNO, KFinlLO.
translated: Bohm, Verner Assar Ludvig, senior physician, Linköping, born July 28th, 1884 in Lund, son of director Herman B. and Augusta Norling. Married in 1912 to Inga Leffler, with whom he had five children: Åke (born 1913), Gunnar and Maj (twins, born 1915), Einar (born 1917), and Brita (born 1925). Bohm earned his M.D. at Lund University in 1906 and his medical license in Stockholm in 1911. He served as assistant in medical chemistry in Lund from 1905 to 1906, assistant at Seraf:las. X-ray clinic from 1909 to 1910, and acting director and amanuensis at the Radiumhemmet clinic in 1911. He later served as assistant at the Seraf:las. surgical clinic and its surgical polyclinic, as well as assistant in its ophthalmology clinic, and acting physician in various locations, including Kristianstad, Eskilstuna, and Söderköping. He became chief physician at Linköping hospital from 1916 to 1923; then he served as hospital physician in Mora from 1923 to 1928 and Hudiksvall from 1928 to 1937. From 1937 he was senior surgeon at the county hospital in Linköping. He was a member of the board of Birgitta nursing school from 1939 onwards and served as its vice-chairman. He was awarded the Royal Order of the Polar Star in 1942, the Order of Vasa, and the Order of the Lion and the Rose.

awards.name: Royal Order of the Polar Star
Order of the Lion and the Rose
